title: Ukrainian Forces Enter Kherson, a Strategic Prize, in a Blow to Putin
description: Jubilant crowds poured into the streets, greeting Ukrainian soldiers and waving flags. But officials said the city was not out of danger, warning of potential Russian reprisals.

title: Court to Reconsider Trump-Era Decision That Favored Alaska Road Project
description: Conservation groups, joined by former President Carter, had sued to reopen the case after a March ruling upheld an Interior Department deal for a road through a national wildlife refuge.

title: At COP27, Biden Casts America as Climate Leader, While Activists Push Him to Do More
description: At climate talks in Egypt, President Biden apologized for his predecessor’s decision to withdraw the United States from the Paris climate agreement.

title: UK Bird Flu Fears Force Even the Tower of London’s Ravens Inside
description: A highly contagious strain of the avian flu has prompted the British government to order precautions.

title: For Biden and Xi, a Long Relationship With Rising Mutual Suspicion
description: The men, who first met as vice presidents, plan to hold face-to-face talks for the first time as national leaders, and at a time when animus defines U.S.-China relations.

title: Explosion on a Kherson Bridge Severs the City’s Last Major Crossing
description: Videos and photographs posted to social media showed the Antonivsky Bridge to be heavily damaged.

title: As Ukraine Makes Gains, Mykolaiv Bears Fierce Russian Attacks
description: The Ukrainian city keeps getting bombed by the Russians just as nearby Kherson appears to be falling back into the hands of Ukraine.

title: Belgium Police Killing May Have Been Terrorism, Officials Say
description: The suspect was on the government’s watch list of potential extremists. Attacks have been rare in Europe in the past few years.

title: U.S. Seeks Closer Ties with India as Tension with China and Russia Builds
description: Treasury Secretary Yellen wants India to be part of the Biden administration’s “friend-shoring” agenda but trade tensions linger.

title: Can the Rhine River Be Saved From Climate Change?
description: Germany has embarked on an ambitious and expensive effort to preserve the river’s historical role as a vital transportation link. But will it work?

title: Large Earthquake Strikes Near Tonga, Setting Off Tsunami Warnings
description: Officials advised people to get to the third floor of buildings if they were unable to flee to higher ground. Videos showed drivers trying to escape the danger.

title: Unconventional Results
description: In states where abortion rights or democracy was on the ballot, Democrats upended the typical midterm result.

title: Russia Says Retreat From Kherson City Is Complete
description: The apparent destruction of a major bridge leading out of Kherson city signaled what appeared to be the end stages of Russia’s withdrawal.

title: China Adjusts Some Pandemic Policies, While Sticking to ‘Zero Covid’
description: Investors cheered the changes, although officials emphasized that measures “must not be relaxed.”

title: Zelensky says dozens of towns and villages in the Kherson region have been retaken.
After 4 Sons Vanish, Their Mother Devotes Her Life to Mexico’s Missing
description: Over 100,000 people are missing in Mexico, but even amid this national agony, one mother’s story stands out both for the scope of her suffering and for her work trying to end the nation’s nightmare.

title: On Alibaba’s Singles Day, Shopping Baskets Are Filled With Chinese Brands
description: As geopolitical and economic pressures mount, homegrown businesses are increasingly the preferred choice over Western competitors in a more insular China.

title: KFC Apologizes for Kristallnacht-linked Promotion
description: An automated push notification sent in error by KFC Germany conflated the infamous 1938 pogrom and “tender cheese with crispy chicken.”

title: Nepal Fights Deforestation, and Wins
description: An effort decades in the making is showing results in Nepal, a rare success story in a world of cascading climate disasters and despair.

title: Putin’s Name Is Absent as Russians Discuss Retreat in Ukraine
description: Big decisions in Moscow are Vladimir Putin’s to make, but the Kremlin and state media are distancing him from the setback in Kherson and downplaying its seriousness.

title: Can There Be a Rights Reckoning for Nations That Don’t Want to Do It?
description: In nations reckoning with atrocities, reconciliation panels and similar bodies often obscure or delay the truth. But that doesn’t mean that international justice has no effect.

title: The Australian Teacher Fighting to Be the World’s Strongest Woman
description: Elly Smith competes in a sport called strongman, where participants attempt to lift, hold, pull or carry everything from dumbbells to airplanes.

title: Top U.S. General Urges Diplomacy in Ukraine While Biden Advisers Resist
description: Gen. Mark A. Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, has made the case that the Ukrainians should try to cement their gains at the bargaining table.

title: Top U.S. General Urges Diplomacy in Ukraine While Biden Advisers Resist
description: Gen. Mark A. Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, has made the case that the Ukrainians should try to cement their gains at the bargaining table.

title: Carbon Dioxide Emissions Increased in 2022 as Crises Roiled Energy Markets
description: Global emissions from fossil fuels are likely to reach record highs this year, new data shows, putting nations further off track from stopping global warming.
